title: Address Books
content: Thunderbird upgraded itself to the latest version and I have had immense problems. My emails and address books did not load. Eventually the emails appeared but after much trouble I still can't see the address books. I tried importing them and those that imported lost a lot of emails and also their names. This is serious for me as my hundreds of personal email addresses and several thousand other important ones are not accessible. I have been using Thunderbird for over 20 years and like it. Please stop mucking around with something that was working. I have wasted about 8 hours or more so far. I HATE the new version. Please tell me how to get my address books up or how to go back to the previous version. Thank you.
creator: vbivell

title: Moving messages between accounts using Message Filters
content:
I'm using Thunderbird 115.4.1 on a Windows machine. I have two IMAP accounts configured.

I set up a message filter rule to move messages from the Inbox to a specific folder based upon the subject. That works fine. Then I changed to rule to instead move the message to a folder on a different account. That doesn't work.

I can manually copy the email from the original account to the second account with no problem. So, Thunderbird has no problem moving a message from one account to another. But, it's not doing that when using a Message Filters rule.

I did look at the filter log. Thunderbird is applying the filter to the message.

When I edited the rule to specify to move the message to a different account, Thunderbird listed both accounts and allowed me to select the folder on the second account. That would seem to indicate that such an operation is valid. So, is this problem a known limitation or issue with Thunderbird?

Does anyone know of any workaround?
creator: mozilla474

title: Last couple of weeks Thunderbird frequently hangs (never-ending blue spinning circle)
content:
Been using Thunderbird for years, seldom have problems. But starting to see the software frequently hanging in the last week or two. Most often, things will be fine, and I'll go to bed. When I wake up, the software is hanging, no messages have been downloaded for hours, the cursor is a small blue spinning circle, and the program is not responding. I have to force-quit with task manager, start it up again, then it runs fine for several hours, before doing the same thing again. Just now, I found it hung again, without having to go to bed first.

I have no way of knowing if any email is being lost during this time or not, but I have no reason to think it is. The problem is not anything major (force quit, then reload is not a horrible inconvenience), but I'd like to avoid the problem.

Only recent change is I created a new gmail account because one place I like to receive emails from seems to be having problems with my own domains' emails, but they don't work with the gmail account either ... go figure. The new gmail account seems to have no problems sending or receiving emails for the most part, but since this problem started happening within the last couple of weeks, and I added the new email in the last couple of weeks, could be connected.
creator: jon135

title: security.tls.version.min 1 not respected (Linux Fedora, flatpak)
content:
I am trying to connect to an email server that is still on tls 1.0 using Thunderbird on Fedora linux (flatpak version). I have set the following parameters 

   security.tls.version.min 1    security.tls.version.enable-deprecated true

but Thunderbird returns a "Non-overidable TLS error occured" and does not successfully connect to the server.

I note that Thunderbird on macOS can in fact connect to the same email server after setting the above two parameters. Thus, this appears to be either a problem with the Linux version, or the fedora Flatpak version in particular.

Does anyone know of a way to get around this? I talked to email provider, but they have no plans to update their tls certificate any time soon...
creator: firefox.legitimateness

title: Problem replying to an email when I am only in BCC list.
content:
I am using Thunderbird 115.4.2 (64-bit) on Windows 11.

I have received two emails where I am only in the bcc list as shown below.

From Adam@gmail.com To Brian@hotmail.co.uk Bcc Chas@hotmail.co.uk

I cannot actually see the Bcc entry.

When I click Reply I get:

From Adam@gmail.com To Brian@hotmail.co.uk

I only discovered this when the intended recipient asked if I had read their email.

Yesterday is the first time it has happened as far as I know.

A subsidiary question is, has Thunderbird recently updated itself without me agreeing to it?
creator: sjquelch57

title: How to make Thunderbird always hide IMAP marked-as-deleted emails?
content:
Hello,


how can I set Thunderbird to always hide emails that have been marked as deleted in an IMAP account?

There is a dropdown "View" which can be set to "Not deleted", which does the job. But this dropdown resets as soon as you select a new folder, which of course makes it impractical to use.

How can I

a) set "Not deleted" as default for all folders

and

b) make Thunderbird instantly hide a message I have just marked as deleted? (Even if the dropdown is already set to "not deleted", a message newly deleted is still just stricken out, but still listed until I select "not deleted" again.)


To make it very clear: Thunderbird's principal behaviour in marking-as-deleted with IMAP is correct and expected. It's just the view filter that doesn't work as required.


Regards
creator: 150d

title: reducing message header size and removing info duplication
content:
My Thunderbird standard display has the message displayed below the list of incoming messages. This message pane take up "Several" lines of display and also duplicates the information in the above message window. Its a waste of space and the actual message has to be reduced in viewable size cause the header block uses it all up.

The area circled in red I want total control over.

Show me how.
creator: pbicmhc

title: Change the density of message list in 115 (in correct way?)
content:
I would like to change the density for the messages list (thread row) and provide a custom value there. e.g. 40px;

In many places, people are showing a solution such as:

``` tr[is="thread-row"] { 

   height: 40px !important;

} ```

But it doesn't work properly. When there are a lot of messages and you start scrolling, then the scroll stops working properly, you can't select messages, the whole thing goes crazy. This is the case on Windows, perhaps on Linux there is not this problem (I do not know).

I tried to use `line-height` instead of `height`, unfortunately the problem still occurs.

I see that I am not the only one who has this problem: - https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/15conez/comment/k0gi9tl/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web2x&context=3 - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1423577#answer-1608118

Do you know the correct way to change this value?

title: Will SuperNova work normally if I delete "Sent" folders and Sent.msf from Profile/Local Folders (and retain "SentCopies" in  Mail/Local Folders)?
content:
I place a copy of Sent emails into "Local Folders/SentCopies" to avoid brief retrieval delays after sending (I use IMAP accounts--Outlook and Gmaill).

Trouble is, my tree display of Local Folders includes Both a "SentCopies" folder and a "Sent" folder (apparently the Account Settings for Local Folders in the past was set for a day to "Sent" for "Place a copy...", before changing to "SentCopies.")

To clean up the tree display and make it less confusing, I would like to remove "Sent" from the Local Folder Display, and see only "SentCopies" in Local Folders, (and continue to see "Sent" and also each account in Unified Folders).

My question: If I use Windows file explorer to delete 2 folders and a file from the Profile/Mail/Local Folders...(the folders "Sent" and "Sent.mosmsgs" and the file "Sent.msf"), will the Unified folders and tree display for Unified and Local folders continue to work normally? Will TB continue to track "Sent" items for both accounts in Unified Folders/Sent, and continue to show and update the "SentCopies" folder in the tree display For Local Folders? And will those deletions remove the usless and confusing folder labeled "Sent" in the Local Folder tree display?

Thank you.






SuperNova is working fine with my two IMAP accounts.
creator: kmartinp
